text.section: Each application for a driver's license shall be made on the form that the Administration requires.

An applicant shall provide:
Satisfactory documentary evidence that the applicant has a valid Social Security number by presenting the applicant's Social Security Administration account card or, if the Social Security Administration account card is not available, any of the following documents bearing the applicant's Social Security number:
A current W-2 form;
A current SSA-1099 form;
A current non-SSA-1099 form; or
A current pay stub with the applicant's name and Social Security number on it; or
Satisfactory documentary evidence that the applicant is not eligible for a Social Security number.
The applicant shall sign the application and certify that the statements made in it are true.

section.section: Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, an applicant for an original license shall submit with the application a birth certificate or other proof of age and identity that is satisfactory to the Administration.

An individual party to an absolute divorce may elect to use a prior legal or true name upon filing an affidavit or other proof, satisfactory to the Administration, of:
The prior name; and
The absolute divorce.
An applicant shall provide satisfactory documentary evidence that the applicant has lawful status.

text.section: If an individual previously licensed to drive in another jurisdiction applies for a license, the Administration may request a copy of his driving record from the other jurisdiction.
If another licensing jurisdiction requests a driving record from the Administration, the Administration may send the record to it without charge.
